project_name = #{projectName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
stu_id = #{stuId,jdbcType=CHAR},

update tbl_scientific set project_name = #{projectName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, stu_id = #{stuId,jdbcType=CHAR}, instructor = #{instructor,jdbcType=CHAR}, school_year = #{schoolYear,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_by = #{createBy,jdbcType=CHAR}, edit_time = #{editTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, edit_by = #{editBy,jdbcType=CHAR} where id = #{id,jdbcType=CHAR}
mapper.select:
select
from tbl_scientific s join tbl_user u1 on s.stu_id = u1.id join tbl_user u2 on s.create_by = u2.id left join tbl_user u3 on s.edit_by = u3.id
and s.project_name like '%' #{projectName} '%'
and s.stu_id like '%' #{stuId} '%'
and u1.name like '%' #{stuName} '%'
and s.school_year = #{schoolYear}
and s.instructor like '%' #{instructor} '%'
order by s.create_time desc limit #{beginNo}, #{pageSize}

select count(*) from tbl_scientific s join tbl_user u1 on s.stu_id = u1.id join tbl_user u2 on s.create_by = u2.id left join tbl_user u3 on s.edit_by = u3.id
and s.project_name like '%' #{projectName} '%'
and s.stu_id like '%' #{stuId} '%'
and u1.name like '%' #{stuName} '%'
and s.school_year = #{schoolYear}
and s.instructor like '%' #{instructor} '%'

select
from tbl_scientific s join tbl_user u1 on s.stu_id = u1.id join tbl_user u2 on s.create_by = u2.id left join tbl_user u3 on s.edit_by = u3.id where s.id = #{id,jdbcType=CHAR}
